intro: Agathosma stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bushveld fumitory, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of pale blue to violet flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It has a compact growth habit and is typically found in open vegetation types such as grasslands and bushveld. Agathosma stenopetala is also valued for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
